connector.description: Send tweets and receive tweets from user's timeline.

camel.sink.path.timelineType.name: camel.sink.path.timelineType
camel.sink.path.timelineType.description: The timeline type to produce/consume. One of: [PUBLIC] [HOME] [USER] [MENTIONS] [RETWEETSOFME] [UNKNOWN]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyHost.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPassword.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyPort.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser
camel.sink.endpoint.httpProxyUser.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken
camel.sink.endpoint.accessToken.description: The access token. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret
camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenSecret.description: The access secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey
camel.sink.endpoint.consumerKey.description: The consumer key. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret
camel.sink.endpoint.consumerSecret.description: The consumer secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

camel.component.twitter-timeline.lazySta.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.twitter-timeline.lazySta.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.twitter-timeline.basicPr.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.twitter-timeline.basicPr.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpProxyHost
camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpProxyPassword
camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpProxyPort
camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter.

camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.name: camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpProxyUser
camel.component.twitter-timeline.httpPro.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter.
